SEARCH
Package src.TaskManager

Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
src.TaskManager.TaskManager
public class TaskManager extends Object
The TaskManager class manages the task queue and the users associated with each task. It allows loading user data from a configuration file, adding tasks for users, and executing the tasks in priority order. Tasks are stored in a priority queue, which ensures that the highest priority tasks are executed first.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskManager

      public TaskManager()

  • Method Details

    • loadConfig

      public void loadConfig(String filename) throws FileNotFoundException
      Loads the configuration file containing user priorities and creates a user list. Each user is assigned a unique ID, and their priority is read from the file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the configuration file containing user priorities.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the specified configuration file is not found. Time Complexity: O(n) The method iterates through each line in the file and parses it. Therefore, the complexity is linear with respect to the number of lines in the file (n).

    • addTask

      public void addTask(int userID, int taskID)
      Adds a task for the specified user. The task is placed in the priority queue. The task will be processed based on the user's priority.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user who owns the task.
      taskID - The unique ID of the task. Time Complexity: O(log n) The add operation for a priority queue (min-heap) requires maintaining the heap property, which has a logarithmic time complexity in relation to the number of tasks in the queue (n).

    • executeTasks

      public void executeTasks()
      Executes tasks in the priority order, printing each task as it is executed. Tasks are processed by removing them from the priority queue, starting with the highest priority task. Time Complexity: O(n log n) The method calls poll() until the queue is empty, which has a complexity of O(log n) for each poll. Since it performs this operation for each task, the overall complexity is O(n log n).
